intro: Eccremanthus eximius, commonly known as the silverleaf heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens and containers. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, and it is also valued for its ornamental appeal. The species is part of the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other ornamental and economically important plants.
